intro: Isocarpha megacephala, commonly known as the giant false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust growth habit. The plant features a tall, branched stem with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its showy yellow flowers appear in dense clusters, giving it a striking appearance. Isocarpha megacephala is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
